author: JamesWTruher
body:
With a single rooted filesystem grafting resources into the filesystem is usually done with mount. However, there is great utility in collapsing a long path into a drivename (Pester uses this functionality in its TESTDRIVE:)
I also believe that a number of scripts use this feature a lot. 

Bruce suggests that PSDRIVES are really just path aliases, and they are too useful to not support

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: Sounds reasonable to me. I'm not sure why this support was originally removed.

title: Should we continue to support <DRIVENAME>:<path> syntax
